futurebusiness.title: Business for the period ending on Thursday 22 October 2009
futurebusiness.subtitle: Includes the business announced by the Leader of the House (which may be changed up to the rising of the House on the day before it is to be taken and is therefore provisional).

item.text: Questions to the Secretary of State for Health, including Topical Questions.

Ten minute Rule Motion: Mr Douglas Carswell: Parliamentary Elections (Recall and Primaries): That leave be given to bring in a Bill to make provision for the recall of Members of the House of Commons in specified circumstances; to provide for the holding of primary elections in such circumstances; and for connected purposes.
Remaining Stages of the Local Democracy, Economic Development and Construction Bill [Lords].
At the end of the sitting: Adjournment: Subject to be announced.
Questions to the Secretary of State for Scotland and to the Prime Minister.

Ten minute Rule Motion: Mr Brooks Newmark: Cervical Cancer (Minimum Age for Screening): That leave be given to bring in a Bill to require NHS bodies in England to provide cervical screening for women aged 20 and over.
Opposition Day (17th allotted day). There will be a debate on an Opposition Motion. Subject to be announced.
At the end of the sitting: Adjournment: Subject to be announced.

Questions to the Church Commissioners, the Public Accounts Commission and the Speaker’s Committee on the Electoral Commission, to the Solicitor General and to the Leader of the House of Commons and House of Commons Commission.
General debate on defence policy.
At the end of the sitting: Adjournment: Subject to be announced.
Private Members’ Bills

bill.name: TEACHING OF BRITISH HISTORY IN SCHOOLS
ROYAL MARRIAGES AND SUCCESSION TO THE CROWN (PREVENTION OF DISCRIMINATION)
bill.motion: And a Motion being made, and the Question being proposed, That the Bill be now read a second time:

bill.name: REGISTRATION OF BIRTHS AND DEATHS (WELSH LANGUAGE)
INSOLVENCY (PROVISION OF INFORMATION TO EMPLOYMENT AGENCIES)
SURFACE WATER AND HIGHWAY DRAINAGE CHARGES (EXEMPTION)
BROADCASTING (PUBLIC SERVICE CONTENT)
bill.motion: And a Motion being made, and the Question being proposed, That the Bill be now read a second time:

bill.name: FORCES WIDOWS’ PENSIONS (EQUALITY OF TREATMENT)
bill.motion: And a Motion being made, and the Question being proposed, That the Bill be now read a second time:

bill.name: FUEL POVERTY
bill.motion: And a Motion being made, and the Question being proposed, That the Bill be now read a second time:

bill.name: EUROPEAN UNION (AUDIT OF BENEFITS AND COSTS OF UK MEMBERSHIP)
HUMAN RIGHTS ACT 1998 (MEANING OF PUBLIC AUTHORITY)
bill.motion: And a Motion being made, and the Question being proposed, That the Bill be now read a second time:

bill.name: THEFT FROM SHOPS (USE OF PENALTY NOTICES FOR DISORDER)
ILLEGALLY LOGGED TIMBER (PROHIBITION OF SALE)
bill.motion: And a Motion being made, and the Question being proposed, That the Bill be now read a second time:

bill.name: PHARMACEUTICAL LABELLING (WARNING OF COGNITIVE FUNCTION IMPAIRMENT)
LAND USE (GARDEN PROTECTION ETC)
bill.motion: And a Motion being made, and the Question being proposed, That the Bill be now read a second time:

bill.name: BRITISH MUSEUM ACT 1963 (AMENDMENT)
bill.motion: And a Motion being made, and the Question being proposed, That the Bill be now read a second time:

bill.name: ONLINE PURCHASING OF GOODS AND SERVICES (AGE VERIFICATION)
COMMON LAND AND REPEAL OF INCLOSURE ACTS
PUBLIC BUILDINGS (PUBLICATION OF ENERGY PERFORMANCE CERTIFICATES)
PUBLIC TRANSPORT (REWARD SCHEME AND CONCESSIONARY FARES)

item.text: At the end of the sitting: Adjournment: Subject to be announced.
Questions to the Secretary of State for Work and Pensions, including Topical Questions.
Opposition Day (18th allotted day). There will be a debate on an Opposition Motion. Subject to be announced.
At the end of the sitting: Adjournment: Subject to be announced.
Questions to the Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs, including Topical Questions.
Second Reading of a Bill.
At the end of the sitting: Adjournment: Subject to be announced.
Questions to the Secretary of State for International Development and to the Prime Minister.
Ten minute Rule Motion: Mr Paul Burstow: Statutory Instruments Act 1946 (Amendment): That leave be given to bring in a Bill to amend the Statutory Instruments Act 1946.
Opposition Day (19th allotted day). There will be a debate on a Liberal Democrat Motion. Subject to be announced.
At the end of the sitting: Adjournment: Subject to be announced.
Questions to the Secretary of State for Transport, including Topical Questions, and to the Minister for Women and Equality.
Topical debate: Subject to be announced.
Motion to take note of the outstanding reports of the Public Accounts Committee to which the Government has replied. Details to be given in the Official Report.
At the end of the sitting: Adjournment: Subject to be announced.
